objenome.util

Enum TypeUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<TypeUtil>
      • objenome.util.TypeUtil
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<TypeUtil>

    public enum TypeUtil
extends java.lang.Enum<TypeUtil>
    This class provides static utility methods for working with Epox data-types.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      • containsSub

        public static boolean containsSub(java.lang.Class<?>[] collection,
                                  java.lang.Class<?> cls)
        Returns true if the given collection contains an element which represents a class which is the same as or is a sub-type of the given class
        Parameters:
        collection - the collection to search for a class that is assignable to cls
        cls - the class that is being searched against the given collection
        Returns:
        true if the given collection contains a class which is the same as or a sub-type of the given class parameter. It returns false otherwise.

      • containsSuper

        public static boolean containsSuper(java.lang.Class<?>[] collection,
                                    java.lang.Class<?> cls)
        Returns true if the given collection contains an element which represents a class which is the same as or is a super-type of the given class
        Parameters:
        collection - the classes to search for one that cls is assignable to
        cls - the class that is being searched against collection
        Returns:
        true if the given collection contains a class which is the same as or a super-type of the given class parameter. It returns false otherwise.

      • allSub

        public static boolean allSub(java.lang.Class<?>[] collection,
                             java.lang.Class<?> cls)
        Returns true if all elements of collection are sub-types of cls, or the same type
        Parameters:
        collection - the classes that must all be sub-types of cls
        cls - the type to compare against collection
        Returns:
        true if all classes in collection are sub-types of, or the same type as, cls and returns false otherwise

      • allSuper

                               java.lang.Class<?> cls)
        Returns true if all elements of collection are super-types of cls, or the same type
        Parameters:
        collection - the classes that must all be super-types of cls
        cls - the type to compare against collection
        Returns:
        true if all classes in collection are super-types of, or the same type as, cls and returns false otherwise

      • allEqual

        public static boolean allEqual(java.lang.Class<?>[] collection,
                               java.lang.Class<?> cls)
        Returns true if all classes in the collection array are equal to cls
        Parameters:
        collection - the classes to compare against cls for equality
        cls - the type to compare against collection
        Returns:
        true if all classes in collection are the same type as cls and false otherwise

      • widestNumberType

        public static java.lang.Class<?> widestNumberType(java.lang.Class<?>... classes)
        Returns the widest compatible numeric type for two primitive numeric class types. Any of Byte, Short, Integer will resolve to Integer.
        Parameters:
        classes - an array of numeric class types, for example, int, long, float, or double.
        Returns:
        the compatible numeric type for binary operations involving both types, or null if there is no compatible numeric type

      • isNumericType

        public static boolean isNumericType(java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Tests whether the given class type is a numeric type (one of Byte, Short, Integer, Long, Float, Double)
        Parameters:
        type - the type to check
        Returns:
        true if it is a numeric type, false otherwise

      • isAllNumericType

        public static boolean isAllNumericType(java.lang.Class<?>... classes)
        Tests whether all given classes are for numeric types (any of Byte, Short, Integer, Long, Float, Double)
        Parameters:
        classes - the types to check for numeric types
        Returns:
        true if all given classes are for numeric types, false otherwise

      • getPrimitiveType

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getPrimitiveType(java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Returns the primitive class of any numeric object class (any of Byte, Short, Integer, Long, Float, Double). If a primitive type is provided then the same type is returned.
        Parameters:
        type - a numeric type, which is either a primitive or an object
        Returns:
        the equivalent primitive class type

      • getObjectType

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getObjectType(java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Returns the object wrapper class type for a primitive class type
        Parameters:
        type - a numeric type, which is either a primitive or an object
        Returns:
        the equivalent object class type
